alert.note: Alert for Chilton; Shelby (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 5:29PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Chilton and southeastern Shelby Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 528 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oak Mountain State Park to near Billingsley. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alabaster, Pelham, Calera, Chelsea, Clanton, Montevallo, Columbiana, Jemison, Wilsonville, Indian Springs Village, Thorsby, Maplesville, Gap Of The Mountain, Oak Mountain State Park, Verbena, Plecher, Lay Lake Dam, Chilton County Motor Sports Park, Shelby County Airport and Pooles Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
